author: Staff Reporter
text:
He insisted that he would open the door if he got his vehicles back

Egmore police have arrested a man for locking the office of a private firm on Ethiraj Salai here over an alleged loan dispute on Wednesday noon.

The man, identified as K. Selvam (49) from Erode district, had arrived the office at KGN Towers and, without speaking a word to anyone, he silently pulled out a long chain and locked the door from outside, while people inside were at work.

“We received a call from the manager, Ramesh Kumar; we went there within ten minutes, opened the door and arrested Selvam, who was standing near the door with keys in his hand,” said a police official.

“He kept insisting that he should get his vehicles back, only then would he open the office,” the official added.

A complaint has been lodged against Selvam and the officials are investigating the case.

“We do not know the exact reason yet, but are looking into it,” the official said.
title: Man locks office over ‘loan dispute’ in Egmore
